event: Tiwanaku culture emerges near Lake Titicaca
Inca Empire expands into Bolivian highlands under Pachacuti
Spanish conquest completed; Bolivia becomes part of Viceroyalty of Peru
Discovery of silver at Potosí, becomes a major source of wealth for Spain
Indigenous uprising led by Túpac Katari besieges La Paz
First independence uprising in Sucre (Chuquisaca Revolution)
Bolivia declares independence from Spain on August 6, named after Simón Bolívar
Bolivia enters Peru-Bolivian Confederation under Andrés de Santa Cruz
Confederation dissolved after defeat by Chile and Argentina
War of the Pacific begins; Bolivia loses coastal territory to Chile
Treaty of Peace and Friendship with Chile confirms loss of coastline
Chaco War with Paraguay begins over disputed Gran Chaco region
End of Chaco War; Bolivia loses territory to Paraguay
National Revolution by MNR; universal suffrage, land reform, and mine nationalization
Military coup ousts MNR government
Che Guevara executed in Bolivia while trying to spark revolution
Return to democracy with Hernán Siles Zuazo as president
Neoliberal economic reforms under President Víctor Paz Estenssoro
Evo Morales elected as Bolivia’s first Indigenous president
New constitution enacted; Bolivia becomes the Plurinational State
Evo Morales resigns amid electoral controversy and protests
Luis Arce elected president; MAS returns to power
